issue.title: [CF 910] DamageShield is not working.
issue.body:
IMPORTANT: If your issue is only occurring with a specific icon, include an export string of the icon in this ticket. Subsequently, if the issue involves an entire group or an entire profile, include the entire export string of the group or profile.

To get an export string, open the icon editor, and click button labeled "Import/Export/Backup". Select the "To string" option for the appropriate export type (icon, group, or profile), and then press CTRL+C to copy it to your clipboard.

FAILURE TO COMPLY WITH THE ABOVE INSTRUCTIONS WILL RESULT IN YOUR TICKET BEING INVALIDATED.

What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. Buff/Debuff icon
2. DamageShield Spell
3.

What do you expect to happen? What happens instead?

===> Icon is not shown.

What version of TellMeWhen are you using? ("The latest" is not a version)

===> I think 6.2.6.
Do you have an error log of what happened?

===> no

Please provide any additional information below (including any export strings if applicable; see above.)

Icon string : ^1^T^SShowTimer^B ^SType^Sbuff ^SName^SDamageShield ^SShowTimerText^B ^SShowTTText^B ^SEnabled^B ^t^N70047^S~`~| ^Sicon^^

p.s. I edited the ticket and sorry for ignoring the rule. It won't be happen again I promise.


> Posted by CurseForge user takilon | Imported from CurseForge issue #910 | Raw

comments.body:
Please do not ignore the default ticket template. Your post does not include enough information for me to be able to figure out what the issue is here. Please reply with the export string of the icon that you are having trouble with.

You don't need to create your own equivalencies. Just enter both spells separated with a semicolon.

Edited Jan 10, 2014

> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

I edited the ticket. I'm sorry for ignoring the rule of the board.

It is wierd that the problem is not occured on my laptop. But, on my desktop, the problem

is occured. I re-installed TellMeWhen, But.....

p.s.

Is it necessary to remove all settings of TMW (file in WTF folder) when re-installing?


> Posted by CurseForge user takilon

What shield are you testing the icon with? It might be one that never got put in the equivalency.

You don't need to delete your saved variables when reinstalling.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

It is divine aegis. My (dicipline)priest friend gave a divine aegis by casting Penance.

Does [Show only mine] mean "show the spell in the player's spell book" ?


> Posted by CurseForge user takilon

No, it means that the icon will only show spells that you cast.

From the tooltip:

Quote:

Check this option to cause this icon to only check for buffs/debuffs that you casted


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

@Cybeloras: Go

Then, if I check the box, then divine aegis casted by priest would not be seen right?


> Posted by CurseForge user takilon
